solution.text:
by using Snell's law, \(n_1\times sin(30)=n_2\times sin(r)\)
\(20\times sin(30)=10\times sin(r)\)
we know sin(30)=\(1\over 2\)
sin(r)=\(20\over 2\times 10\)
sin(r)=1
r=90

content.text:
When a ray of light passes from 1 medium to other the angle formed at the boundary of the two mediums with the normal is related by Snell's law
Given \(n_1\times sin(i)=n_2\times sin(r)\)(Snell's law), where \(n_1\)and \(n_2\) are the refractive index of medium1 and medium2.
If angle of incidence(i) is equal to 30 and \(n_1\) and \(n_2\) are 20 and 10 respectively.
Find the angle of refraction(r).

solution.text:
we know sin(45)=cos(45)=\(1\over \sqrt 3\)
we know for any angle between 0 to 45 degree
The value of sin \(\theta \) is less than cos \(\theta \)
For example cos(0)>sin(0), cos(30)>sin(30)
The value of sin \(\theta \) increases as \(\theta \) increases and the value of cos \(\theta \) decreases as \(\theta \) increases
at \(\theta \) = 45 the values of sin \(\theta \) and cos \(\theta \) are equal
also as cos(90)=0 and tan \(\theta \)=\(sin \theta\over cos \theta\)=\(\frac 10\) that is not defined
similarly as cos(90)=0 and sec \(\theta \)=\(1\over cos \theta\)=\(\frac 10\) that is not defined
and as sin(0)=0 and cot \(\theta\)=\(cos \theta\over sin \theta\)=\(\frac 10\) that is not defined

content.text: From the options given below choose the correct ones

correct.text: The value of cos20\(^\circ\)-sin20\(^\circ\) is always greater than 0
The values of , cot(0), tan(90) and sec(90) are 'Not Defined'

solution.text:
side opposite to angle(p)=240cm=perpendicular
tanP=\(perpendicular\over base\)
Angle(P)=30 degree, tan(30)=\(1\over \sqrt3\)
therefore, base=\(240\sqrt3\)
sin(p)=\(perpendicular\over hypotenuse\)
sin(30)=\(\frac 12\)=\(240\over hypotenuse\)
hence the longest side, hypotenuse=\(480cm\)

content.text:
In a triangle PQR right-angled at Q, it is given that the side opposite to the angle(P)=30 is 240cm.
Find the longest side of the triangle.

solution.text:
\(1\over \sqrt3\)=tan(30) and \(\sqrt 3\over 2\)=sin(60)
sin(1A+8B)=sin(60) and tan(1A-8B)=tan(30)
1A+8B=60 and 1A-8B=30
adding the above 2 equations we get 2A=90
hence, A=\(90\over 2\)=45

content.text:
sin(1A+8B)=\(\sqrt 3\over 2\) and tan(1A-8B)=\(1\over \sqrt3\)
Given that 0<1A+8B<90 and 1A>8B find the value of A

solution.text:
we know cos(30)=\(\sqrt 3\over 2\)
we know cosec(60)=\(2\over \sqrt 3\)
we know cot(45)= 1
we know sin(30)=\( 1\over 2\)
putting the values in the expression we get
\({{3\times 3\over 4}+{9\times 4\over 3}-{8}}\over 1\)
2.25+12-8
6.25

content.text:
Solve and find the value of the expression given below
\(3cos^2(30)+9cosec^2(60)-8cot^2(45)\over sin^2(30) + cos^2(30)\)
